text: Harry A. Monk, Sr. (c. 1902 – November 23, 1979) was a Canadian curler. He was a member of 1947 Brier Champion team (skipped by Jimmy Welsh), playing as lead, representing Manitoba. A member of the Deer Lodge Curling Club in Winnipeg, he was also a three-time provincial champion."Harry Monk: champion lead", Winnipeg Free Press, Wednesday, November 28, 1979, Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada, pg. 80 ==References== Category:1902 births Category:1979 deaths Category:Brier champions Category:Canadian male curlers Category:Curlers from Manitoba Category:Scottish emigrants to Canada Category:Sportspeople from Winnipeg
title: Harry Monk
